hc.server.util

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • hc.server.util.Scheduler

  • public final class Scheduler
extends Object
    this class is a wrapper to Quartz Scheduler, the follow document is copied/modified from Scheduler.

    A Scheduler maintains a registry of Jobs and Triggers. Once registered, the Scheduler is responsible for executing Job s when their associated Trigger s fire (when their scheduled time arrives).

    After a Scheduler has been created, it is in "stand-by" mode, and must invoke its start() before it will fire any Jobs.

    Trigger s can then be defined to fire individual Job instances based on given schedules.

    the stored job can also be 'manually' triggered through the triggerJob(String).

    Author:
    James House, Sharada Jambula

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_DO_NOTHING
      Instructs the Scheduler that upon a mis-fire situation, the cron trigger wants to have it's next-fire-time updated to the next time in the schedule after the current time (taking into account any associated JobCalendar, but it does not want to be fired now.
      static int MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_FIRE_ONCE_NOW
      Instructs the Scheduler that upon a mis-fire situation, the cron trigger wants to be fired now by Scheduler.

      • MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_DO_NOTHING

        public static final int MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_DO_NOTHING
        Instructs the Scheduler that upon a mis-fire situation, the cron trigger wants to have it's next-fire-time updated to the next time in the schedule after the current time (taking into account any associated JobCalendar, but it does not want to be fired now.
        See Also:
        MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_FIRE_ONCE_NOW

      • MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_FIRE_ONCE_NOW

        public static final int MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_FIRE_ONCE_NOW

        Instructs the Scheduler that upon a mis-fire situation, the cron trigger wants to be fired now by Scheduler.

        See Also:
        MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_DO_NOTHING

    • Method Detail

      • addCalendar

        public final void addCalendar(String calName,
               JobCalendar calendar)
        Add (if exists then replace) the given JobCalendar to the Scheduler.

        if fail to add calendar or calendar is exists but replace is false, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        Parameters:
        calName -
        calendar - instance of JobCalendar, for example AnnualJobCalendar, CronExcludeJobCalendar, DailyJobCalendar, HolidayJobCalendar, MonthlyJobCalendar and WeeklyJobCalendar.

      • addCronTrigger

        public final void addCronTrigger(String triggerKey,
                  String cronExpression,
                  String calendarName,
                  String jobKey)
        add and schedule a cron trigger.

        if fail to add cron trigger, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

        Note :
        if trigger is upon a mis-fire situation, then be fired once now.
        Parameters:
        triggerKey -
        cronExpression - for more about Cron Expression, please click http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/tutorials/crontrigger.html
        calendarName -
        jobKey -
        See Also:
        addCronTrigger(String, String, TimeZone, String, Date, Date, int, String, String)

      • addCronTrigger

        public final void addCronTrigger(String triggerKey,
                  String cronExpression,
                  TimeZone cronTimeZone,
                  String calendarName,
                  Date startTime,
                  Date endTime,
                  int misfireOption,
                  String jobKey,
                  String description)
        add and schedule a cron trigger.

        if fail to add and schedule cron trigger, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        Parameters:
        triggerKey -
        cronExpression - for more about Cron Expression, please click http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/tutorials/crontrigger.html
        cronTimeZone - null means default.
        calendarName - the name of the Calendar that should be applied to this trigger.
        startTime - null means start now.
        endTime - null means never end.
        misfireOption - one of MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_DO_NOTHING, MISFIRE_INSTRUCTION_FIRE_ONCE_NOW or others in future.
        jobKey - if null then do nothing.
        description -

      • addJob

        public final void addJob(String jobKey,
          String jrubyScripts)
        Add (if exists then replace) the given Job to the scheduler. The Job will be silent until it is scheduled with a Trigger or Scheduler.triggerJob() is called for it.

        the added job is durable, see deleteTrigger(String) for more.

        if fail to add job, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        Parameters:
        jobKey -
        jrubyScripts -
        See Also:
        addJob(String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • addJob

        public final void addJob(String jobKey,
          String jrubyScripts,
          boolean storeNonDurableWhileAwaitingScheduling)
        Add (if exists then replace) the given Job to the scheduler. The Job will be silent until it is scheduled with a Trigger or Scheduler.triggerJob() is called for it.

        the added job is durable, see deleteTrigger(String) for more.

        With the storeNonDurableWhileAwaitingScheduling parameter set to true, a non-durable job can be stored. Once it is scheduled, it will resume normal non-durable behavior (i.e. be deleted once there are no remaining associated triggers).

        if fail to add job, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • addJob

        public final void addJob(String jobKey,
          String jrubyScripts,
          boolean isDurable,
          boolean jobShouldRecover,
          boolean storeNonDurableWhileAwaitingScheduling)
        Add (if exists then replace) the given Job to the scheduler.

        if fail to add job, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        Parameters:
        jobKey -
        jrubyScripts -
        isDurable - false means the job will also be deleted if there is no other trigger refers to it.
        see deleteTrigger(String).
        jobShouldRecover - Instructs the Scheduler whether or not the Job should be re-executed if a 'recovery' or 'fail-over' situation is encountered. If not explicitly set, the default value is false.
        storeNonDurableWhileAwaitingScheduling -

      • deleteJob

        public final boolean deleteJob(String jobKey)
        Delete the identified Job and any associated Triggers.
        Returns:
        false means not found or exception thrown,
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • deleteJobs

        public final boolean deleteJobs(List<String> jobKeys)
        Delete the identified Jobs and any associated Triggers.

        Note that while this bulk operation is likely more efficient than invoking deleteJob(JobKey jobKey) several times, it may have the adverse affect of holding data locks for a single long duration of time (rather than lots of small durations of time).

        Returns:
        false means one/more were not deleted or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • deleteTrigger

        public final boolean deleteTrigger(String triggerKey)
        Remove the indicated trigger from the scheduler.

        If the related job does not have any other triggers, and the job is not durable, then the job will also be deleted.

        Returns:
        false means not found or exception thrown,
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • deleteTriggers

        public final boolean deleteTriggers(List<String> triggerKeys)
        Remove all of the indicated triggers from the scheduler.

        If the related job does not have any other triggers, and the job is not durable, then the job will also be deleted.

        Note that while this bulk operation is likely more efficient than invoking unscheduleJob(TriggerKey triggerKey) several times, it may have the adverse affect of holding data locks for a single long duration of time (rather than lots of small durations of time).

        Returns:
        false means one/more not found or exception thrown,
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • getTriggerEndTime

        public final Date getTriggerEndTime(String triggerKey)
        Get the time at which the Trigger should quit repeating - regardless of any remaining repeats (based on the trigger's particular repeat settings).
        Returns:
        null means the never end or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        getTriggerFinalFireTime(String)

      • getTriggerFinalFireTime

        public final Date getTriggerFinalFireTime(String triggerKey)
        Returns the last time at which the Trigger will fire, if the Trigger will repeat indefinitely, null will be returned.

        Note that the return time *may* be in the past.

        Returns:
        null means repeat indefinitely or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • getTriggerFireTimeAfter

        public final Date getTriggerFireTimeAfter(String triggerKey,
                           Date afterTime)
        Returns the next time at which the Trigger will fire, after the given time. If the trigger will not fire after the given time, null will be returned.
        Returns:
        null means not fire after given time or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

        Parameters:

      • getTriggerKeys

        public final List<String> getTriggerKeys()
        get the names of all registered triggers.
        Returns:
        null means exception thrown,
        if no trigger returns a list with zero size.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • getTriggerNextFireTime

        public final Date getTriggerNextFireTime(String triggerKey)
        Returns the next time at which the Trigger is scheduled to fire. If the trigger will not fire again, null will be returned. Note that the time returned can possibly be in the past, if the time that was computed for the trigger to next fire has already arrived, but the scheduler has not yet been able to fire the trigger (which would likely be due to lack of resources e.g. threads).

        The value returned is not guaranteed to be valid until after the Trigger has been added to the scheduler.

        Returns:
        null means not fire again or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • getTriggerPreviousFireTime

        public final Date getTriggerPreviousFireTime(String triggerKey)
        Returns the previous time at which the Trigger fired. If the trigger has not yet fired, null will be returned.
        Returns:
        null means not yet fired or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

        public final Date getTriggerStartTime(String triggerKey)
        Get the time at which the Trigger should occur.
        Returns:
        null means exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • isShutdown

        public final boolean isShutdown()
        Reports whether the Scheduler has been shutdown.
        Returns:
        false means is shutdown or exception thrown,

      • isStandby

        public final boolean isStandby()
        Reports whether the Scheduler is in stand-by mode.
        Returns:
        false means not standby or exception thrown,
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        standby(), start()

      • isStarted

        public final boolean isStarted()
        Whether the scheduler has been started.

        Note: This only reflects whether start() has ever been called on this scheduler, so it will return true even if the Scheduler is currently in standby mode or has been since shutdown.

        Returns:
        false means not started or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        start(), isShutdown(), isStandby()

      • isTriggerMayFireAgain

        public final boolean isTriggerMayFireAgain(String triggerKey)
        Used by the Scheduler to determine whether or not it is possible for this Trigger to fire again.

        If the returned value is false then the Scheduler may remove the Trigger from Store.

        Returns:
        false means not fire again or exception thrown.
        invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.

      • isValidCronExpression

        public final boolean isValidCronExpression(String cronExpression)
        Indicates whether the specified cron expression can be parsed into a valid cron expression.

        for more about Cron Expression, please click http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/tutorials/crontrigger.html
        Parameters:
        cronExpression - the cron expression
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the given expression is a valid cron expression

      • pauseAll

        public final void pauseAll()
        Pause all triggers, however, after using this method resumeAll() must be called to clear the scheduler's state of 'remembering' that all new triggers will be paused as they are added.

        When resumeAll() is called (to un-pause), trigger misfire instructions WILL be applied.

        if fail to pause all, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        resumeAll(), standby()

      • pauseJob

        public final void pauseJob(String jobKey)
        Pause the Job with the given key - by pausing all of its current Triggers.

        if fail to pause job, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        resumeJob(String)

      • pauseTrigger

        public final void pauseTrigger(String triggerKey)
        Pause the Trigger with the given key.

        if fail to pause trigger, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        resumeTrigger(String)

      • resumeAll

        public final void resumeAll()
        Resume (un-pause) all triggers - similar to calling resumeTriggerGroup(group) on every group.

        If any Trigger missed one or more fire-times, then the Trigger's misfire instruction will be applied.

        if fail to resume all, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        pauseAll()

      • resumeJob

        public final void resumeJob(String jobKey)
        Resume (un-pause) the Job with the given key.

        If any of the Job'sTrigger s missed one or more fire-times, then the Trigger's misfire instruction will be applied.

        if fail to resume job, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        pauseJob(String)

      • resumeTrigger

        public final void resumeTrigger(String triggerKey)
        Resume (un-pause) the trigger with the given key.

        If the Trigger missed one or more fire-times, then the Trigger's misfire instruction will be applied.

        if fail to resume trigger, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        pauseTrigger(String)

      • shutdown

        public final void shutdown()
        Halts the Scheduler's firing of Triggers, and cleans up all resources associated with the Scheduler. Equivalent to shutdown(false).

        The scheduler cannot be re-started.

        if fail to shutdown, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        shutdown(boolean)

      • shutdown

        public final void shutdown(boolean waitForJobsToComplete)
        Halts the Scheduler's firing of Triggers, and cleans up all resources associated with the Scheduler.

        The scheduler cannot be re-started.

        if fail to shutdown, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        Parameters:
        waitForJobsToComplete - if true the scheduler will not allow this method to return until all currently executing jobs have completed.
        See Also:
        shutdown()

      • standby

        public final void standby()
        Temporarily halts the Scheduler's firing of Triggers.

        When start() is called (to bring the scheduler out of stand-by mode), trigger misfire instructions will NOT be applied during the execution of the start() method - any misfires will be detected immediately afterward (by the JobStore's normal process).

        The scheduler is not destroyed, and can be re-started at any time.

        if fail to standby, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        start(), pauseAll()

      • start

        public final void start()
        Starts the Scheduler's threads that fire Triggers. When a scheduler is first created it is in "stand-by" mode, and will not fire triggers. The scheduler can also be put into stand-by mode by calling the standby() method.

        The misfire/recovery process will be started, if it is the initial call to this method on this scheduler instance.

        if fail to start, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        startDelayed(int), standby(), shutdown()

      • startDelayed

        public final void startDelayed(int seconds)
        Calls start() after the indicated number of seconds. (This call does not block). This can be useful within applications that have initializers that create the scheduler immediately, before the resources needed by the executing jobs have been fully initialized.

        if fail to start, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        See Also:
        start(), standby(), shutdown()

      • triggerJob

        public final void triggerJob(String jobKey)
        Trigger the identified Job (execute it now).

        if fail to trigger job, invoke getThrownException() to get thrown exception.
        Parameters:
        jobKey -
